required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Rapid Maxillary Expansion and Protraction by Expander Differential Opening EDO in Cleft Lip and Palate Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Treatment Outcome of Cleft Palate Patients Treated With Differential Opening Expander With Rapid Protocol and Face Mask Using CBCT

lead_sponsor.agency: Faculty of Dental Medicine for Girls

clinical_study.source: Faculty of Dental Medicine for Girls

brief_summary.textblock: maxillary expansion in cleft palate patient with expander and using face mask.

detailed_description.textblock:
patient with cleft palate and maxillary constriction, deficiency will be treat using expander with differential opening which has two screws on anteriorly and another posteriorly positional in midline palate anteriorly as much as possible.
rapid maxillary expansion will be using one turns in day(two turns in the morning and two turns in the evening).
with petit face mask for maxillary protraction and superimposition CBCT will be taken between before and after treatment .

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in 3 dimensions of skull before and after expansion
primary_outcome.description: Full skull Cone Beam Computerized Tomography

arm_group.description: Cleft patient with transverse maxillary constriction and anteroposterior deficiency

intervention.intervention_name: expander with deferential opening and petit face mask
intervention.description: bonded expander with two screws and vertical hooks for attachment face mask. adjustment face mask with forehead and chin anchorage

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ● Patients of both sexes.
- Cleft lip and palate patients.
- All patient age range 8-12 years.
- All the case showed maxillary arch constriction and deficiency.
- All patients had maxillary permanent first molars.
- Primary lip adhesion and palatal closure.
Exclusion Criteria:
- • Absent maxillary permanent first molars.
- Patients had received any surgical assisted rapid maxillary expansion, maxillary protraction or fixed orthodontics before.
- Less than two dental unit beside maxillary first molar.
- Uncooperative patients/parents.

overall_official.affiliation: Lecturer of orthodontics department Faculty of Dental Medicine for Girls Alazhar univercity

facility.name: Faculty of Dental Medicine for Girls Al-Azhar University

link.description: Rapid maxillary expansion and face mask with class III malocclusion

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Faculty of Dental Medicine for Girls

patient_data.ipd_description: treatment cleft lip and palate patient with EDO with rapid protocol and face mask
